snippet: When employment is an important factor in keeping people out of the criminal justice system, how do we keep from shutting out some applicants?
abstract: Editorial addresses prejudices faced by enormous number of Americans with criminal records, even those convicted for minor infractions, particularly in terms of employment; calls for series of measures to improve situation, including long-term efforts to change attitudes of potential employers and public as a whole.
lead_paragraph: When employment is an important factor in keeping people out of the criminal justice system, how do we keep from shutting out some applicants?
